trans-unit.source: Use JDBC to query Hive on Azure HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use JDBC to query Hive on Azure HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use JDBC to connect to Hive on Azure HDInsight and remotely run queries on data stored in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use JDBC to connect to Hive on Azure HDInsight and remotely run queries on data stored in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Connect to Hive on Azure HDInsight using the Hive JDBC driver
trans-unit.target: Connect to Hive on Azure HDInsight using the Hive JDBC driver

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will learn how to use JDBC from a Java application to remotely submit Hive queries to an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will learn how to use JDBC from a Java application to remotely submit Hive queries to an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Hive JDBC Interface, see [HiveJDBCInterface](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HiveJDBCInterface).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Hive JDBC Interface, see [HiveJDBCInterface](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HiveJDBCInterface).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Either Linux-based or Windows-based clusters will work.
trans-unit.target: Either Linux-based or Windows-based clusters will work.

trans-unit.source: The [Java Developer Kit (JDK) version 7](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html) or higher.
trans-unit.target: The [Java Developer Kit (JDK) version 7](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html) or higher.

trans-unit.source: [Apache Maven](https://maven.apache.org).
trans-unit.target: [Apache Maven](https://maven.apache.org).

trans-unit.source: Maven is a project build system for Java projects that is used by the project associated with this article.
trans-unit.target: Maven is a project build system for Java projects that is used by the project associated with this article.

trans-unit.source: Connection string
trans-unit.target: Connection string

trans-unit.source: JDBC connections to an HDInsight cluster on Azure are made over 443, and the traffic is secured using SSL.
trans-unit.target: JDBC connections to an HDInsight cluster on Azure are made over 443, and the traffic is secured using SSL.

trans-unit.source: The public gateway that the clusters sit behind redirects the traffic to the port that HiveServer2 is actually listening on.
trans-unit.target: The public gateway that the clusters sit behind redirects the traffic to the port that HiveServer2 is actually listening on.

trans-unit.source: So a typical connection string would like the following:
trans-unit.target: So a typical connection string would like the following:

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: When establishing the connection, you have to specify the HDInsight cluster admin name and password.
trans-unit.target: When establishing the connection, you have to specify the HDInsight cluster admin name and password.

trans-unit.source: These authenticate the request to the gateway.
trans-unit.target: These authenticate the request to the gateway.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following Java code opens a new connection using the connection string, admin name, and password:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following Java code opens a new connection using the connection string, admin name, and password:

trans-unit.source: Queries
trans-unit.target: Queries

trans-unit.source: Once the connection is established, you can run queries against Hive.
trans-unit.target: Once the connection is established, you can run queries against Hive.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following Java code performs a __SELECT__ from a table, limiting the results to only three rows, then displays the results:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following Java code performs a __SELECT__ from a table, limiting the results to only three rows, then displays the results:

trans-unit.source: Example Java project
trans-unit.target: Example Java project

trans-unit.source: An example of using a Java client to query Hive on HDInsight is available at [https://github.com/Blackmist/hdinsight-hive-jdbc](https://github.com/Blackmist/hdinsight-hive-jdbc).
trans-unit.target: An example of using a Java client to query Hive on HDInsight is available at [https://github.com/Blackmist/hdinsight-hive-jdbc](https://github.com/Blackmist/hdinsight-hive-jdbc).

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions in the repository to build and run the sample.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions in the repository to build and run the sample.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
